intro: Paphiopedilum argus var. sriwanae, commonly known as the Sriwana’s orchid, is a rare and highly sought-after species native to the mountainous regions of Thailand. It is characterized by its striking, velvety petals and a distinctive, intricate lip that resembles a butterfly. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid with a pseudobulb and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It prefers cool, humid environments with well-draining soil and partial shade. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
